content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task that requires me to:
1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Implement as many new ideas as possible as PopeBot skills in the .pi/skills/ directory
3. For each skill: create SKILL.md, write implementation code, and write/run tests
4. Email a comprehensive progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by fetching content from these three repositories to understand what tools, skills, and architectures they contain.

I'll use the web-fetch skill to get information from these GitHub repos. Let me start by exploring each repository.

content.text: I'll systematically scan these three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement as many as possible as PopeBot skills. Let me start by exploring each repository.

content.thinking: Let me explore the directories more deeply to find skills, tools, and interesting architectures. I should look at the specific directories that might contain skills or tools.

content.thinking: Let me explore the thepopebot package structure differently - it seems the pi-skills directory might be in the npm package. Let me also explore more of the zeroclaw and openclaw repos to find tools and skills.
Let me explore more specific capabilities from these repos. I should look at the actual tool implementations and skills to understand what patterns I can adopt.
